content.title: What is Blockchain
content.description: A blockchain,originally block chain,is a growing list of records, called blocks, which are linked using cryptography.Each block contains a cryptographic hash of the previous block, a timestamp, and transaction data (generally represented as a merkle tree root hash).

content.title: Steps to be followed
content.description:
• Request to get added to alias
  • Request to access gitlab
  • Request to access sharepoint
  • Reuqest Jira access

content.title: What is Ethereum
content.description: thereum is an open-source, public, blockchain-based distributed computing platform and operating system featuring smart contract (scripting) functionality.It supports a modified version of Nakamoto consensus via transaction-based state transitions.

content.title: Installation
content.description:
• Go to the site https://nodejs.org/en/download/ and download the necessary binary files. In our example, we are going to the download the 32-bit setup files for Node.js.
  • Double click on the downloaded .msi file to start the installation. Click the Run button in the first screen to begin the installation.
